resources.string: You\'re a wizard on your way to get a magical flower for your potions. The flower only blooms on a blue moon, three days from now. You set out from your hovel and head onto the winding path.
The forrest path forks, the left path twists, heading up a mountain path, the right side leading by a river. Which do you choose?
You take the mountain path, it leads past a the entrance to what looks like a cave. You think you see something gliter from the dark within. What do you do?
Investigate the cave entrance or continue on your long way around the mountain?
You enter the cave. The glimmer seems to have been from trails of gold piled up ahead, how do you want to proceed?
Use some magic concealment or grab the gold and leg it?

Thinking of all the wide sleeve robes you could buy, you approach the pile of gold. As you make it within a few feet of the gold, the mound growing as more of the cave becomes visible, it stirs suddenly. The gigantic head of a dragon protrudes from the mound of gold, you try to turn back but too late! The dragon having spotted you, raises its head and decimates you with it\'s fiery breath. Your body falls to ash, a fitting death for a greedy thief.

You cast a spell of concealment on yourself and cautiosuly make your way to the pile of gold, more appearing as you see the size of the cave ahead. while observing the mound you realise it\'s moving steadily up and down, a dragon lurks within, waiting to prey on the greedy. You spot light from a tunnel on the other side of the gold.
Turn back and continue up the mountain or see where the tunnel leads?
You make your way further up the mountain...
